message: @pheze But then there's other stuff too, like you can see who has the most stars in a group here: https://convore.com/feedback/members/
im working on a website that'll have a kind of chat and I was looking at different options. It's django based, like you
@pheze Yeah, we definitely want to get there.
yep
have you considered using pubnub ?
Nah, didn't really consider pubnub
@pheze There's the e-mail notifications, you can turn more on if that helps...
Ha cool
ops, yeah, sorry. I kind of started talking on something unrelated to the topic
Sorry for the interrogatory btw :D
It would also help if we could share individual posts on twitter/facebook instead of an entire topic.
hehe cool :)
Know what I mean?
@pheze Yeah, definitely.  We have some changes coming down the pipeline that will make it more fun to "hang out" on Convore more.
@pheze no worries, we love talking about Convore :)
thanks @craigshipp :p
We added a "trending groups" thing too https://convore.com/discover/trending/
Is there a big reason? Something that I don't know that should really convince me not to use it :p
Are you still 3 working on it?
yo

I've been "afk" from convore for a couple weeks (mostly 6). I was curious about the progress made and the difference so far with the older versions? I saw the "Post to twitter/facebook is more fun" <-- great initiative. Is there other cool things? :)
@pheze Oh man there's been a *ton* of little changes here and there
I don't know, for a component so important to us, I'd want to see and be able to hack on the source code...and pubnub is a hosted service.
@pheze The biggest ones are direct messages and muting
Check out the "Send me summary emails" part here https://convore.com/settings/notifications/
@pheze thanks :)
I was talking with @leah (i think) about the vision of convore trying to get new users
Like to make it more popular and not only "for open source"
I guess the Link to twitter and facebook are a great initiative for that.

We've made some effort to create new groups and invite people on it.. it's cool for the first 10-15 mins but then, it seems to lose focus.. not because convore is not cool but mostly because we "forget"
Would be great if there was a kind of "You need to do that *tomorrow* or I don't know
Something that force me to come back and see the new stuff
Yeah, but I had to turn it off since I was in so many groups :D
Ahh yeah, well there's a daily or weekly summary one you can get now, which won't send too many

@ericflo  I'm curious to know.. what tool did you use for the api backend. Simple url.py -> view and manually returning the {'error':} or a higher level "plugin" working with your models.. or something else?
sigh
I think we're using the same library for the CACHE/ minifying js :D
I'm actually reading convore javascript' minified source code
see if you had the wiki you could see how the javascript changed over time js
is it {% compress..
I didn't know about the blog, I'll read it more often
maybe you guys should start creating release notes or a change log wiki
the blog is great, don't get me wrong but it is a good place to showcase a new feature, i think the change log/release notes could get really technical
yeah, fair enough
xD
I never know what method to use
@pheze Yep it's just simple stuff, no special library
ok
I had another question but I'll ask on Django xD

You guys should steal the Announcements functionality from Acunote.  It's like that that yellow dialogue that shows up after you subscribe to a group, except showing new features and with built-in polling and feedback link
